channel.title: Tavern Chat
channel.description: "I listen to the Tavern Chat podcast every morning, sometimes I think its NPR, till the F bomb drops then I remember I am in geek heaven instead!" Enjoy a daily chat with your Old School Gaming Bartender :)
channel.author: erik tenkar

item.title: What is the BrOSR?
item.description: Jeffro - What is the #BrOSR? The #BrOSR is real D&D. It is AD&D played as intended. It is successful fantasy campaigns that just won’t quit. It is a fundamentally different type of play that is distinct from the conventional approaches to roleplaying that have dominated hobby gaming over the past forty years

item.title: Ability Checks in D&D Go Back to the Player's Handbook in 1977 - What!?!
item.description: AD&D PHB (1977, p. 76): Any creature at the edge (1’) of such a pit uses its dexterity score as a saving throw to avoid falling into the hole, with a score equal to or less than the dexterity meaning that a fall was avoided. item.title: Project Sigil - A Natural Extension of Baldur's Gate 3 AND a VTT for ALL RPG Rulesets? What!?!

I'm not surprised that WotC firmly has the Baldu's Gate 3 Community solidly in their sights, but I was surprised to find them pitch Project Sigil for use with OTHER (unnamed) RPGs. item.title: D&D Beyond Update 2024 Shift: WotC Listens, Adjusts Plans
item.description: Members of the DnD Beyond community, and 2014 5e community, in particular, were heard by the powers that be at WotC. Late on a Sunday Nignt WotC announced a course change, and it is huge: "Players who only have access to the 2014 Player’s Handbook will maintain their character options, spells, and magical items in their character sheets. Players with access to the 2024 and 2014 digital Player’s Handbooks can select from both sources when creating new characters. Players will not need to rely on Homebrew to use their 2014 player options, including spells and magic items, as recommended in previous changelogs." https://www.dndbeyond.com/posts/1806-2024-d-d-beyond-ruleset-changelog-update?utm_campaign=DDB-PHB-2024-&utm_source=FACEBOOK&utm_medium=social&utm_content=14476792382 Looking to support The Tavern? Use our affiliate links and help yourself to some good stuff while helping The Tavern! item.title: On Communication at the Gaming Table - It is More Than setting a Scene and Interpreting Die Rolls
item.description: Yesterday, Rach and I talked a bit about consent at the gaming table. The conversation that has popped up about that cast has been amazing, both on YouTube and on Facebook, and thanks to that ongoing conversation, I think I missed something yesterday. Communication at the gaming table has to occur before consent can even be an issue, and part of that communication is being honest with your GM before the session even starts.
item.dc:creator: erik tenkar
item.itunes:summary: Yesterday, Rach and I talked a bit about consent at the gaming table. The conversation that has popped up about that cast has been amazing, both on YouTube and on Facebook, and thanks to that ongoing conversation, I think I missed something yesterday. Communication at the gaming table has to occur before consent can even be an issue, and part of that communication is being honest with your GM before the session even starts.

item.title: On Consent at the Gaming Table Over Removing Complete Themes (re: recent Paizo response)
item.description: Strangely enough, I find myself inching closer to X-Cards at the gaming table for organized play / convention games over completely removing themes that some may find triggering. Rach joins me for this one, as I figured we needed the opinion of one that was NOT a grognard ;) https://owenkcstephens.com/2021/12/13/from-a-freelancer-an-open-letter-to-erik-mona/

item.title: PDFs are Convenient, But Print Can't be RetConned - Is WotC Making 5e Earlier Printings Collectible
item.description: It's all over the interwebs. WotC has been making stealth changes to the lore of many of its releases, to correct language that it sees as possibly problematic. This is both the advantage and curse of digital content. But has this made earlier 5e printing more valuable and collectible? https://www.wargamer.com/dnd/races-alignments-lore-removed https://boundingintocomics.com/2021/12/16/wizards-of-the-coast-removes-lore-deemed-problematic-from-dungeons-dragons/ https://www.belloflostsouls.net/2021/12/dd-wotc-removes-racial-alignments-retcons-drow-in-new-batch-of-errata.html https://www.reddit.com/r/dndnext/comments/rg4jut/writeup_of_all_the_lore_thats_beein_removed_from/
item.dc:creator: erik tenkar

item.title: Why is Tenkar called "Tenkar"? A Brief History of the Name and Why it is Used
item.description: Ah, you've gotta love the internet trolls. On yesterday's video, a troll spammed the comments section with my "real" last name (not a secret, it's been public for years on Swords & Wizardry Light and Swords & Wizardry Continual Light). I figured it was time to explain where the name came from, why I used it, why I continue to use it, and more.
item.dc:creator: erik tenkar

item.title: Talking Crit Special Edition - Why Is TSR3 Filing Suit over Trademarks that it Has Abandoned?
item.description: TSR3 has surrendered or abandoned nearly every trademark it has named in its legal action against WotC. In 2 weeks, if TSR3 takes no further action, the Star Frontiers TM will be abandoned. So, why the legal action filed against WotC? https://www.trademarkelite.com/trademark/trademark-detail/90276506/STAR-FRONTIERS https://www.trademarkelite.com/trademark/trademark-detail/90893809/STAR-FRONTIERS https://www.trademarkelite.com/trademark/trademark-detail/90148334/mark https://www.trademarkelite.com/trademark/trademark-detail/90148524/TSR https://www.trademarkelite.com/trademark/trademark-detail/90124839/TSR-THE-GAME-WIZARDS https://www.trademarkelite.com/trademark/trademark-detail/90276510/BLACKMOOR https://www.trademarkelite.com/trademark/trademark-detail/90124287/TSR https://www.trademarkelite.com/trademark/trademark-detail/90884176/TSR https://www.trademarkelite.com/trademark/trademark-detail/90124788/mark

item.title: TSR Con Rescheduled for Gary Con Weekend - "New" Star Frontiers RPG Out of Stock Before Publication
item.description:
TSR Con has been moved from the weekend of July 4th (when every hotel within 15 miles was likely sold out to non-gamers) to the same weekend as Gary Con (where every hotel within 15 miles is likely sold out to gamers). A not so subtle attempt to steal bandwidth.

Also, there is a Star Frontiers Game listed for sale at the Dungeon Hobby Shop Museum, but it's out of stock. Actually, it hasn't been published yet, nor has it been announced, but the sales page is up.

item.title: Do You Read RPG Forums? Which Ones and Why or Why Not?
item.description: Back in the old-time, Google+ and Forums ruled the roost. Blogs were looming large. Today, Google+ is dead, blogs are dying, and forums are suffering. It is the day of social media, podcasts, and YouTube. Do you read RPG forums? Which ones? If you don't, why not?
item.dc:creator: erik tenkar
item.itunes:summary: Back in the old-time, Google+ and Forums ruled the roost. Blogs were looming large. Today, Google+ is dead, blogs are dying, and forums are suffering. It is the day of social media, podcasts, and YouTube. Do you read RPG forums? Which ones? If you don't, why not?

item.title: Follow Up - The Gaming Industry Pays Poorly and Market Size is Only Part of the Issue
item.description:
No one has "game designer" as a fall back position in their potential jobs list. You become a "game designer" because you want to create games, not because you failed in some other occupation. 

There are so many would be game designers, and so few positions that pay a fulltime salary, that anyone going into the "game industry" as their primary occupation better think good and hard. Because if game design isnt your side gig but your primary occupation, you likely need a lucrative side gig.

This does not mean that creatives are paid what they are worth. They are, however, likely paid what the market can bear.

The opportunities to make a living wage in game design are few, and as a general rule, only go to the most skilled. Being "good" at game design simply isnt good enough, not when there are thousands of would be game designers vying for a small handful of well paying spots.

item.title: Arduin - Dave Hargrave on DM's Versus Angry Players
item.description: I've started to delve deeply into The Arduin Trilogy. Although I own the books in print in their original digest size, I find them easier to read in the nicely laid out and formatted PDF. Today I was struck by Dave's article on DM's Vs Angry Players, and thus I remark on it.
item.dc:creator: erik tenkar

item.title: Why The Tavern is a Neutral Ground?
item.description: There is a current discussion going on in the gaming community at large about where certain publishers and others in the community stand politically. The Tavern, and by extension, your bartender, is very much apolitical. That apparently is a political stance detested by both extremes.

item.title: Yes, Virginia, With the Right Group, a Virtual Table Top (VTT) can Emulate an In-Person Gaming Group
item.description: Earlier tonight I played in Session Zero of JoetheLawyer's Fantasy Heartbreaker. The session was a blast, not because of the system (which is fine and mostly familiar) but because of the players. If your online group already knows each other, emulating a face-to-face experience is easier than many think.

item.title: Steve Perrin Has Passed - Now is the Time to Thank Those That Have Influenced Your Formative Years
item.description: We are reaching critical mass when it comes to the first generation of RPG creators, and it no longer surprises me to find out we've lost another, although it saddens me just the same as it ever did. Social media allows you to reach and thank those that have had an influence on your life, as a gamer and beyond. Thank them now, because tomorrow may be too late.

item.title: Why Do So Many Adventures Begin in a Tavern & Nepotism in the Walls - Why I Disclose My Connections , Sometimes Annoyingly So ;)
item.description:
You know the trope: you all meet at a tavern. But why is that? What makes a Tavern, the local watering hole, such an integral part of kicking off so many RPG adventures?

There is a certain brush you paint with when members of your development group and playtesters leave glowing reviews for your product and fail to mention their connections to it. I try to mention the connections I have to individuals and companies whenever I review a product, because the potential customer has a right to know of potential biases in said review.
item.dc:creator: erik tenkar

item.title: GenCon 2021 Announces Mask Mandate & How Not to Make Friends on Social Media & How Social Media Friendship Does Not = Real Friendship
item.description:
GenCon 2021 has announced that there will be a mask mandate in effect for all attendees, vaccinated or not. They also hint that a vaccination mandate may come into effect prior to the convention.   https://gencon.blog/2021/08/06/august-health-and-safety-update/

I don't care what your personal beliefs are if you want to be friends on social media. I want to discuss what we share in common - a love for gaming.

I don't care what your personal beliefs are if you want to be friends on social media. I want to discuss what we share in common - a love for gaming.

item.title: Some Useful Skills for Players of TableTop RPGs & Your Players Are Like a Dog on a Leash - Let Them Lead the Way But Keep Some Control
item.description:
We often talk about the skills one needs to learn as a GM/DM, but what is often overlooked are the skills one needs as a player. These skills are often real-life social skills, and I touch upon them in this installment of Tavern Chat.

Our dog Danke enjoys exploring on her walks. We let her lead the way most times, but on occasions, we must redirect her or even take the lead. Its the same in your campaign...

item.title: What Future Does the Post Pandemic World Hold for Tabletop Gaming & Marmoreal Tomb Hits 2nd Weekly Content Goal
item.description:
Many jobs have moved to work from home and many tabletop campaigns have moved to Virtual Tabletops -VTTs-. Are we picking up new creators as folks either work from home or are home with enhanced unemployment benefits? Are the changes we have seen in the method of play - the jump in virtual play and virtual conventions - here to stay?

Benoit hit his 2nd Monday Goal and the backers of the Marmoreal Tob will be getting Chapter 1 of the Wilderness Expansion and the Wilderness Expansion map. Games Workshop had huge profits during Covid and is giving its employees 5k pound bonuses.

item.title: D&D Beyond Self Inflicts Wound, TSR3 Abandons Some TMs, and a Marmoreal Tomb Update
item.description:
D&D Beyond canceled a contest where they offered digital prizes and claimed rights to use all entries. Lesson learned the hard way.

Yep, TSR3 has or is in the process of, abandoning at least three graphical trademarks. 

There is an update on the Marmoreal Tomb Kickstarter - Benoist has hit his first due date and succeeded. Sadly, Brian Fitzpatrick of Moebius Adventures passed away this weekend from an accident during rafting.

item.title: Choosing a Style for My Next Campaign -Adventure Path, Episodic, Hexcrawl, or Megadungeon & Basic Fantasy RPG - An Oft-Forgotten OSR Gem
item.description:
I need to choose a style of play for my next campaign. It will have my old group of players from high school and college and will be either an adventure path, episodic, a hex crawl, or a mega-dungeon.

Wherein I talk a little bit about BFRPG, the OSR's oft-forgotten gem, and a bargain too. This is an affiliate link to BFRPG on Amazon: https://amzn.to/3Aii3Ib, Your purchase goes to support this channel. 

https://www.basicfantasy.org/

item.title: How Do We Attract Younger Players to the OSR? - Can Too Many Choices for Your Sandbox Lead to its Demise?
item.description:
Over 40% of D&D 5e players are under 25. How do we get the OSR to tap into that demographic? 

I was watching Professor Dungeon Master over at https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCD6ERRdXrF2IZ0R888G8PQgand I realized he had it right. A sandbox is about choices, but not limitless ones, at least not if the DM wishes to retain his sanity ;)

item.title: Some Common Sense Social Media Rules for the Business Minded that Don't Want to get Blindsided - A Look Back at Some Not So Recent Failed to Deliver RPG KSs, Why They Failed & What to Avoid
item.description:
Social media in the OSR has been a shit show for the last two weeks or so. When official business accounts argue with the gaming community and try to win arguments, you know it isn't going to be good.

A look at some Kickstarter that have failed to deliver, years after they claimed they would. Far West, Ernest Gary Gygax Jr.'s Marmoreal Tomb Campaign Starter, Appendix N Adventure Toolkits and City State of the Invincible Overlord

item.title: New(est) TSR Twofer & What the Heck is Wonderfilled?
item.description:
There's a press release stating that the original studio of TSR Games is back. As a homage, perhaps. But this isn't the REAL TSR, which is owned lock, stock, and barrel by WotC. And just who the heck is Woderfilled and why did they put out the press release?

There's a new TSR, which claims to be the return of the original TSR. What is it, what is it not, and what obligations do its owners owe the gaming community?

item.title: Only 11% of D&D Players are 40+ and a New D&D Survey
item.description:
I was shown an article by a Taverner which went over some of the D&D 5e demographics. With only 11% of D&D 5e players being 40 years plus, what does that mean to the OSR market, which largely skews older.

’m out and about and figured I’d share a follow up on last night’s episode regarding WotC’s survey numbers and some of the comments in regards.

Yep, right after I was talking about a prior D&D survey, a new D&D survey from WotC pops up - and some folks are getting additional questions with an NDA  https://survey-d.dynata.com/survey/selfserve/53b/21051093?src=facebook#?

item.title: Hat Trick Episode and Catch Up - D&D 6e, VTT Numbers and what it means& Risus for Sale (with obligations)
item.description:
Yep, a triple episode. A podcast Hat Trick and post-con catch up :)

D&D White box released in 1974. AD&D 1e released (sorta) in 1977. AD&D 2e released in 1989. D&D 3e released in 2000. D&D 3.5 2003. D&D 4e in 2008 and D&D 5e released in 2014. When will D&D 6e release?

I've been told that ALL Pathfinder players moved over to the Foundry VTT. Just how popular are the various, major virtual tabletops in comparison to each other?

Yep, the Risus RPG is for sale, complete with $300 to $3,000 in Kickstarter obligations. You must make an offer to get actual financial details - I kid you not!

item.title: Ravenloft & Xenophobia / Pathfinder 1e's Success was Due to the Failure of D&D 4e
item.description:
Apparently, xenophobia has been removed from the Ravenloft 5e release. I've always seen xenophobia as a primary characteristic of Ravenloft, no matter if the PCs were humans or demihumans, they were strangers and a possible danger.

Pathfinder 1e was a success in large part to much of the D&D community rejecting D&D 4e. Pathfinder 2e is a direct response to the success of D&D 5e. Why is Pathfinder losing market share to Dungeons & Dragonns 5e? Why isn't Pathfinder 2e the success that Pathfinder 1e was right out of the box?

I use years worth of Roll20 Orr Reports looking at the trends for Pathfinder and 5e.

item.title: Is Paizo's Pathfinder 2e Gasping Its Last Breath? & Alcohol at The Gaming Table - Cons & Pros
item.description:
Another twofer ;)

Paizo has launched their SECOND Pathfinder 2 Humble Bundle in the 21 months since Pathfinder 2 released in the summer of 2019. Two Humble Bundles of new material for a new RPG system are the signs of failure, not just of market share, but of management. Paizo had its birth by being formed to directly support the 3x edition of Dungeons & Dragons. Will its only way to save itself be to support D&D 5e?

I never used to allow alcohol at the game table. It was a hard and fast rule that I've changed over the years. I discuss why it was and why it is now

item.title: Announcing SWCL Digest Edition and Follow Up to Gamer Entitlement
item.description:
I’ve been asked by many over the past few years for a digest-sized edition of the Swords & Wizardry Continual Light rules. With some extra prompting by James Spahn, it is now in the works. In addition to new material by James Spahn, it will have a professional layout and editing, a new color cover we have commissioned to be completed by James Shields, a new logo, new interior art (B&W or color is up for discussion) and possibly more content, depending on feedback from the community. The rules themselves are not changing. This is a new printing with additional material, not a new edition.

Epi wrote in about Gamer Entitlement. His insights are interesting and I respond. Also, S&W Continual Light 2nd is coming in September

item.title: Can Mook Rules and Crits Find a Balance in the OSR?
item.description: Chad calls in with a suggestion about Mooks not getting critical hits, but the PCs getting such because they are heroes. I take it one step further, and propose using critical hits for PCs, major NPCs, and climatic encounters. Also, Zak S will soon be dishing the dirt on the Vampire 5e fiasco.
item.dc:creator: erik tenkar
item.itunes:summary: Chad calls in with a suggestion about Mooks not getting critical hits, but the PCs getting such because they are heroes. item.title: Blogs Ain't Dying, But They ARE Changing Because of Unforeseen Factors
item.description: Taylor called the show to follow up on my earlier comments about blogs. He's right, blogs aren't dying, but they certainly are receding in importance, at least in the OSR. There are many factors for that: the relative ease one can podcast via Anchor or Vidcast on YouTube, the death of Google+, the advent of self-publishing, and the relatively low cost of entry associate with such (almost any word processing program can get you started and the ability to monetize your creations). In many ways, it's a perfect storm... Still, the entry bar to blogging is still set at Zero, and I still blog on a daily basis at tenkarstavern.com.
item.dc:creator: erik tenkar

item.title: Why I Don't Play with Crits & Fumbles at My Table
item.description: I no longer play with crits and fumbles when I run an RPG session. Critical hits and fumbles have the potential to affect the player characters as well as their adversaries, and as most adversarial encounters are meant to be one and done, critical hits and fumbles carry over detrimentally for the PCs from one encounter to the next.

item.title: Was D&D 50 Years Old on April 17? Maybe...

"According to Dave Arneson's Corner of the Table newsletter, Vol. III, #4"  "There will be a medevil "BRAUNSTEIN" April 17, 1971 at the home of David Arneson from 1500 hrs to 2400 hrs with refreshments being available on the usual basis. Players may come at any time and any number are welcome to attend what should prove to be an exciting time.  It will feature mythical creatures and a poker game under the Troll's bridge between sunup and sundown."

item.title: Tavern Chat Twofer - The Great Kingdom Documentary & Long Lost Mystara Manuscript
item.description:
Dueling documentaries of the legacy of Dungeons & Dragons left only one standing. What is the latest update from The Great Kingdom, and what can those that backed "the other" documentary do to, if not be made whole, at least get something of value? 

Jeff Grubbs long lost Mystara World Setting manuscript, originally written for AD&D 2e (and replaced by Karameikos: Kingdom of Adventure on the TSR release schedule), with setting appropriate kits and such, will be released at the Piazza later this year with the permission of WotC.

item.title: Are You a Referee or a Game Master?
item.description: The way I see it, a referee (or judge) is one that runs a play session with a strict interpretation of the rules, while a game master (or dungeon master) is more concerned about engaging his or her players, but there is certainly overlap between the two, and most that run RPGs have skills that fall into both categories.

item.title: Luke Crane Loses Job as Vice President at Kickstarter Over Perfect RPG Fiasco & Disputed Gygax Wills Go to Trial on June 7, 2021
item.description:
Luke Crane, best known for the Burning Wheel RPG, and recently promoted to Vice President and Head of Community at Kickstarter, was forced to resign from his position at Kickstarter, over the Perfect RPG Fiasco.

The Perfect RPG went up in flames when it was revealed that Crane had snuck Adam Koebel in the project without the knowledge of other involved creators. Koebel, co-designer of Dungeon World, fell from grace in 2020 when he "broadcast a TTRPG scenario involving in-fiction sexual assault live on Twitch."

item.title: Gamers' Health with Rach & Tenkar - Don't Cheat Yourself, Reward Yourself
item.description: I often hear folks talk about how "today is their cheat day", so they can eat whatever they want, smoke, drink, avoid exercise, etc - simply put, they are looking for an excuse not to succeed. You should reward success, not fool yourself into thinking you can succeed via cheating.
item.dc:creator: erik tenkar
item.itunes:summary: I often hear folks talk about how "today is their cheat day", so they can eat whatever they want, smoke, drink, avoid exercise, etc - simply put, they are looking for an excuse not to succeed. You should reward success, not fool yourself into thinking you can succeed via cheating.

item.title: Doing High Level Abilities at Lower Levels in AD&D - The Role of Scrolls
item.description: I've always felt that gameplay broke down fairly fast after achieving name level in AD&D 1e, as that is where casters fully come into their own, and fighting classes are still useful as more than meat shields. But how do you satisfy the urge of your players for higher-level spells and other abilities? Scrolls, of course!

item.title: When is Run as Written Wrong?
item.description:
Earlier today, I stood out in the snowstorm here in NYC and spoke about the time I killed a party with a randomly rolled blizzard, thus the danger of always running "let the dice fall as they may." Tonight, I talk about some of the dangers of "run as written."


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VZg1MaKxc4Y&ab_channel=ErikTenkar

item.title: The Dark Trails RPG is now Weird Frontiers
item.description: David Baity, the writer/publisher of the Dark Trails RPG that was Kickstarted back in 2019, shared today that the name has been changed to the Weird Frontiers RPG.  David went into some of the background behind the decision to change the name of Dark Trails, and I share his post and comment on such.

item.title: E871 - What a Cat Taught Me About Running a Sandbox Campaign (and it doesn't have to do with kitty litter)
item.description: We took in Sadie just over a week ago, she was a young stray. We kept her in one room for the first few days, then expanded her world to two more rooms, and then this evening allowed her to explore the rest of the house. It occurred to me it's just like running a sandbox campaign, you start out small with few options and slowly expand the world to many options...
item.dc:creator: erik tenkar

Our mailing list is growing fast - join it and catch all the going-ons at The Tavern and beyond.

item.title: E854 - Add The Tavern's YouTube Channel For Your Viewing Pleasure

The Tavern has had a YouTube Channel for years, and this very podcast is mirrored there. Starting next week I'll be adding Games from the Basement, a retrospective of my game collection from the 1980s to the mix. Additionally, I plan on live streaming some episodes of The Tavern Chat Podcast to enable live feedback. Same with future Fireside Chats.

So subscribe at YouTube.com/ErikTenkar

item.title: E853 - Live on Sunday Afternoon, a Fireside Chat with Vince Florio, Father of OSR Podcasting
item.description: I'm sure Vince will disavow being called the Father of OSR Podcasting, but without Vince, there would have been no Roll for Initiative, Save or Die, THAC0's Hammer, The Brainstorm Podcast, and so many others. Vince got me started with podcasting and I'm looking forward to having a Fireside with him to discuss where he's been, where he is, where he is going, and get some opinions from him on the current state of the hobby.
item.dc:creator: erik tenkar
item.itunes:summary: I'm sure Vince will disavow being called the Father of OSR Podcasting, but without Vince, there would have been no Roll for Initiative, Save or Die, THAC0's Hammer, The Brainstorm Podcast, and so many others. item.title: E497 - Zak Did NOT Record This Podcast (Nor did James Raggi)
item.description:
James Raggi published Zak Has Nothing to do With This Book at GenCon this summer, with a multi-page preface where he ranted about the community and defended Zak S. It was sold in PDF on DriveThruRPG until earlier today when James changed the title and removed the preface. I ordered the physical copy.

item.title: E437 - Thoughts and Observations on the latest Roll20 Orr Report
item.description:
When "apples to apples" becomes "apples to oranges", it's often because one does not want direct comparisons to be made. We haven't seen the last 4 quarters of the Roll20 Orr Report, where they discuss numbers related to games run and players using the various RPG systems supported by Roll20. The system used to give us those numbers have changed, and I speculate as to why.

https://blog.roll20.net/post/186546450860/the-orr-group-industry-report-q2-2019-back-and

item.title: E406 - Designers & Makers Fireside Chat with Ben Barsh (Pacesetter Games)

item.title: E400 - Is Morrus / ENWorld F'n with a 2013 Kickstarter Backer & Denying Him his KS Reward out of Spite?
item.description:
I know what its like do deal with asshole customers (I worked retail for 8 1/2 years) I also know what it is like dealing with an angry public that makes things personal when you can't respond in kind (cop for 20 years) Is is worth 100 British Pounds to make an asshole that you've wronged go away and not fuck with you current Kickstarter? I would call that money well spent. I guess Morrus / ENWorld doesn't see it the same way.

https://www.rpgpub.com/threads/kickstarter-a-touch-more-class-is-live-and-funded-in-just-4-minutes.3144/

https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/enworld/rebuilding-en-world

I would call that money well spent. I guess Morrus / ENWorld doesn't see it the same way.

item.title: E346 - Tom DeSanto is Looking for $300K plus in Legal Fees from Gail Gygax
item.description: Gail Gygax was nice enough to share some emails she received from the law office that Tom DeSanto has retained in his lawsuit against Gail. Additionally, I explain how criminal and civil courts differ and how decisions are made in civil court. It is much less cut and dry than in a criminal court.

item.title: E341 - RPG Sales were up 18% in 2018
item.description:
From ICV2 - https://icv2.com/articles/news/view/43024/hobby-game-sales-total-1-5-billion-2018 hobby game sales were down 3% last year (driven by an 14% drop in Collectible Games - think Magic the Gathering, Pokeman and the like) while RPG sales were up 18%. Interesting times.

item.title: E333 - I Only Recently Realized Elves in Swords & Wizardry Must be Multi-Classed or Single Class Thieves
item.description:
Apparently I need to read my RPG rulebook just a wee bit closer going forward. I just recently realized Elves in Swords & Wizardry can only be fighter/magic-users, fighter/magic-user/thieves or plain old thieves. No single class fighters or magic-users, and no multi classing with just thief and a singe other class. Go figure.

Frank likes to convert adventures and source materials on the fly between systems and the system his is about to release - Hypertellurians (and which can be found on his website - https://mottokrosh.com/) or direct link (https://mottokrosh.com/hypertellurians/core/) is made to be conversion friendly from other systems.

item.title: James Smith (Dreams of Mythic Fantasy) Has Passed Far too Soon

James Smith (Dreams of Mythic Fantasy) passed yesterday. He was one of the early OSR bloggers and his return to the blogging scene in November of 2018 was long overdue. God bless. Far too soon.

item.title: E329 - Spell Components, Segments, Limited Shield Use - Rules From 1e Missing from Most OSR Games
item.description:
Verbal, Somatic, Material - the three types of spell components in AD&D 1e. How much of that has carried over to the OSR clones. Segments, spell interruption, shield size and number of use - we've dropped them all.

item.description:
In today's installment in the Designers & Makers Fireside Chats I sit down with Glynn Seal - aka Monkeyblood. Glynn is one of the premier mapmakers in the OSR and his Midderlands setting is second to none. Be warned - our recording app hiccuped about 27 minutes into the episode, but we recovered. We talk everything and anything related RPG and old school gaming.

item.title: E323 - Is Guilt Burning Down the House Gary Built?
item.description:
Gail is still at it. More than a dozen disjointed postings on Facebook today about DeSanto, Luke Gygax and even little ole me. Could it be that the DeSanto lawsuit and the revelation of a second will that does not leave the rights to the IP with Gail (or her designated inheritor) after her death is pushing her to the edge. Or is it manipulation, and attempt to appear incompetent to get out of the lawsuit and the contract she signed. I was forwarded an interesting PM right before I recorded this which may change your mind...

item.title: E309 - Talking Crit with Erik & Mike - Gary Con & More
item.description:
This is the first of a weekly series called Talking Crit with Erik & Mike. Michael Badolato (Bad Mike) and myself (Erik Tenkar) are well known to be able to riff of each other for hours on end. We've been told we should take the show to the podcast airwaves and so we have. We talk Gary Con, a pulled Kickstarter, Paizo, WotC and whatever else catches our attention. Squirrel!

We've been told we should take the show to the podcast airwaves and so we have. We talk Gary Con, a pulled Kickstarter, Paizo, WotC and whatever else catches our attention. Squirrel!

item.title: E308 - Designers & Makers - Fireside Chat with Jeff "Jolhoeft" (Virtua Rasa VTT)
item.description:
In today;s Fireside Chat I talk with Jeff "Jolhoeft" of the Virtua Rasa Virtual Table Top. We had some technical issues with the voice server on Discord while recording the first 25 minutes or so, but we ended the chat strong :)

Basic Access to Virtua Rasa is free. We’re trying to fund Virtua Rasa entirely with the community’s support! We don’t collect anything but your email address, and we don’t sell anyone’s personal information or send any unsolicited email — we only need your email to help you reset your password if you forget it.

https://virtuarasa.com/vr/

item.title: E304 - Found My Voice and Huge Kickstarter Roundup
item.description:
Tonight I highlight well over a dozen really cool gaming Kickstarters.

Google is your friend :)

Strange New World Gazetteer: Weird Colonial Roleplaying Zine

An RPG and OSR setting zine for adventuring in a strange fantasy version of colonial America. Fearsome creatures, witchcraft and weird.


Xboat: a Traveller RPG 'zine

A fanzine supporting the Traveller role-playing game. #ZineQuest


Fantasy World Creator + APP: Modular tiles for TABLETOP RPG

Write your adventure with the included APP, create maps and make them live with creatures token. REPRINTED and UPDATED VERSION


DCC RPG Module: Reckoning of the Gods-Into the Shadow Realm

Trespass into a parallel realm to heist the hoard of an ancient evil. A booklet of two level 3 DCC RPG adventures (adapts to any RPG).


The City of Great Lunden

A City Setting for Old School RPGs - The Midderlands setting compatible.


Spiral Isles

A pointcrawl adventure module for 5th Edition and Swords and Wizardry rulesets.


Lost Classes and Cannibal Corpses - Two Original RPG Zines

One Zine featuring re-imaginings of two character classes from proto RPG days. One adventure module.


Terror of the Stratosfiend : A DCC RPG Zine

A new tentacle and sorcery zine for the DCC RPG. (ZineQuest)


Traveller RPG: The Journal of the Travellers Aid Society

The Journal of the Traveller's Aid Society returns, in a brand new full colour, slipcase format.


Wizard Burial Ground: A Dungeon-Punk RPG Book (Zine Quest)

Prog Rock inspired Dungeon-Punk resource book full of plot hooks, monsters, NPCs, and magic items (Zine Quest)


Metal Gods of Ur-Hadad Zine Returns!

Four years in the making, the original Metal Gods team returns for three more issues of metal-fueled mayhem for the DCC RPG


Draugr & Draculas

An old-school RPG zine about undead vikings and vampires


Mercenaries Spies & Private Eyes RPG by Michael Stackpole

A New Edition of the rulebook for Mercenaries, Spies, and Private Eyes (MSPE) a modern role playing game by Michael Stackpole.


Secrets of the World Harvesters

An RPG adventure for DCC (Dungeon Crawl Classics)


The Folio: Black Label #1

A fantasy adventure for a more refined RPG gamer in both classic AD&D and 5th Edition D&D formats.

item.title: E300 - I Got Fake Newsed By Frank - Oh, and its Episode 300!
item.description: So, apparently Frank was making a funny about the DNC being in Milwaukee in July. Ah well, I still appreciate my usual sources that send me links and screenshots, even if we did get punked ;) 300 episode 300 in 300 days - damn. 8 Fireside Chats in 8 days starting tonight. Double damn!

Double damn!

item.title: E299 - Frank Con, Con Man Ken and Con Crud - What a Day
item.description: Oh my. What a day. Rach and I returned from Gary Con earlier today. Not as early as it would have been if taxis had been running as usual at LGA. Getting on the wrong Select Bus and heading towards 106 Street in Manhattan wasn't helpful. I think I'm coming down with some con crud. Frank M wants to do a con in July and needs organizers. I also think he needs more time - its in 4 months. And the return of Con Man Ken.

item.title: E297 - Gary Con Day 3 and Ken Whitman Spins His Wheels with the Spinward Traveller Kickstarter
item.description: Rappan Athuk - The Mouth of Doom 3d Terrain was auction off at Gary Con earlier today. Tomorrow is my last day to run it. Ken Whitman gives the Spinward Traveller Kickstarter its first update in 2 1/2 years. You go Kenny!

item.title: E296 - Gary Con Day 2 - Unionized Demons Renovate Rappan Athuk's Mouth of Doom
item.description: We kicked off the Rappan Athuk: Mouth of Doom series of sessions at Gary Con this morning. The set up is a bit mixed up, but that's what happens when unionized demons are in charge of the renovations ;)

item.title: E295 - Kotaku Article on Gygax is Out - Fluff Piece Gone Wrong
item.description: The Kotaku article on Gail Gygax went live today. It was supposed to be a fluff piece for Gail, but instead it makes her look paranoid and in need of some professional help. The two paragraphs on me were interestingly full of inaccuracies. The only Memorial Gary needs is Gary Con.

The two paragraphs on me were interestingly full of inaccuracies. The only Memorial Gary needs is Gary Con.

item.title: E294 - Follow Up on Falling Down and Some Legal Thoughts on Trademarks
item.description: We have voicemails from Jason Hobbs and Joethelawyer as well as an anonymous (but known by me) email regarding falling from grace. Why listen to me when you can listen to my betters :)

item.description: Yep, our reporter friend is back, now with secret screenshots of me making offensive jokes about Gail Gygax. As you might expect, I talk about the latest letter.

item.title: E292 - Designers & Makers Fireside Chat with VBWyrde Elthos RPG & Mythos Machine)
item.description:
In tonight's Designer's & Makers Fireside Chat I sit down at the virtual bar with VBWyrde. VB has written his own RPG called Elthos but also a world building app / service called the Mythos Machine. We delve deep into the granularity of both and I begin to fanboy the Mythos Machine. You have been warned ;)

Elthos RPG Website: https://elthos.com/  Elthos RPG Rules Books: https://www.drivethrurpg.com/browse/pub/9675/ElthosRPG or  https://elthos.com/product/elthos-rpg-core-rules-book/  

Mythos Machine - Live Site: https://mythosmachine.elthos.com/  Mythos Machine - Free Open Beta / Test Site: https://test.mm.elthos.com/  Mythos Machine - World Weaver's Strategy Guide: https://mythosmachine.elthos.com/OutwardDocumentation/WorldWeaverStrategyGuide.htm  

Elthos Project - Total Scope: https://elthos.com/elthos-project/   Questions can be directed to the #Elthos Channel on the Tenkar's Tavern Discord Server - link below

item.title: E291 - Are We at Fault? Have we Made Godlings out of Imperfect Heroes and Doomed them to Fall from Grace?
item.description:
Are we at fault, at least to some extent, for the inability of our gaming heroes to admit to their own faults, their human weaknesses and instead encourage them them to do everything they can to save their image, an image we as a community have helped to create, even if it means mistruths, misdirection and worse being told to that very community? They are, after all, simply human but we don't allow them to ask for that very human gesture - forgiveness.

item.title: E290 - Wherein I Explain How I Came to My Conclusion over the Frank Mentzer Dragonsfoot Fiasco
item.description:
I received an email (echoing many of the comments I've seen on Facebook and elsewhere) questioning my conclusions on the Frank Mentzer Dragonsfoot Fiasco based on the grounds that Frank is an honorable man that would not lie. I like Frank. Really. He was one of the first of the "old guard" to acknowledge me and the Tenkar's Tavern blog.

That doesn't mean I ignore evidence because I like the man. In today's episode I give some insights into my background in handling investigations such as this.

item.title: E282 - Gen Con Bans Zak S - Do We Now Have a Slippery Slope?
item.description: Its been building over the last week and a half, but the un-personing of Zak S has pretty much been completed. I don't like Zak - I personally think he's a piece of shit. I just don't like companies banning and / or removing folks because they fear the small but vocal outrage brigade.

item.title: E278 - Designers & Maker - Fireside Chat with Krillion GreyDragon (D20Pro VTT)
item.description:
On this episode of Tavern Chat we continue with our Designers & Makers series of Fireside Chats. Today I sit down at the virtual tabletop with Krillion GreyDragon. Krillion is a member of the D20Pro team. D20Pro is a virtual tabletop that allows folks from all over the world to play on a virtual tabletop. (VTT). Krillion and I talk VTTs, D20Pro, customer service, free online tools to make VTT tokens, gaming and board games and much more.

https://d20pro.com/

item.title: E275 - Roll20 Got Hacked - 4 Million Account Records Listed for Sale Online
item.description:
Yep, Roll20 (and a bunch of other sites) got hacked. 4 million Roll20 accounts are for sale (the bundle has a total of 127 million records for the bargain price of $14,500 in bitcoin.) Roll20 says passwords are safe and no financial data was stolen.

https://techcrunch.com/2019/02/14/hacker-strikes-again/

https://app.roll20.net/forum/post/7209691/roll20-security-breach

item.title: E270 - Morbid Mandy Accuses Zak S of Abuse
item.description:
Seems like you can't spit without finding allegations of abuse by an RPG creator underneath where your spittle lands. Earlier this evening, Morbid Mandy, Zak S' recently ex-girlfriend, posted a very personal and revealing post of the abuse she claims to have suffered at the hands of Zak. You can find the claims here:  https://www.facebook.com/amandapatricianagy/posts/10215845527064252

In today's episode, I talk a bit about the interactions I've had with Zak S online and why my experiences with Zak make Mandy's claims likely to be accurate in my view.

Links to all things Tavern:

item.title: E267 - Designers & Makers - Fireside Chat with Courtney Campbell (Hack & Slash)
item.description:
With this episode I have a fireside chat with Courtney Campbell of the Hack & Slash blog (among many other avenues of creativity.) We talk multiple income streams, creativity, love & hate, real life, drive, emotion, kickstarters, Con Man Ken, Gail, Gareth and everything under the sun. If you listen to only one episode on the Designers & Makers series of fireside chats, this might be the one to listen to.

item.title: E262 - Milestones Oh My! Podcast, Discord and The Black Isle
item.description:
Yesterday was the new high water mark as far as the Tavern Chat Podcast goes - over 1700 plays. The Tenkar's Tavern Discord server, where all of the live interviews take place is knocking on 1500 members. Oh, and the crowdsourced setting book, The Black Isle Gazetteer is now available in print for cost. Woot!

item.title: E261-You Should Rarely Give Interviews to the Press - Trust Me, They Don't Care About Your Campaign
item.description: There are interviews and there are "interviews". I prefer to call what I do Fireside Chats as interviews seem both more formal and intrusive. When the press wants to interview you, even if it seems informal it WILL be intrusive. They have a story to sell and clicks to get clicked.

item.title: E254 - New Recording Limits on Anchor & Savage Worlds Adventurer's Guild goes Live
item.description: Anchor now limits recording made via the web app to 30 minutes (doesn't effect mobile apps nor recording made with outside software) Pinnacle launches the Savage Worlds Adventurers Guild a bit differently then similar programs - less IP available for use but creators retain more of the royalties.  https://support.drivethrurpg.com/hc/en-us/articles/360020874952-Savage-Worlds-Adventure-s-Guild-SWAG-Content-Guidelines

item.title: E240 - Gareth Skarka of Far West Shame Threatens to Punch Your Host in the Throat (& calls me names)
item.description: Ah, good old Gareth Skarka. He has more empty promises than a politician. Now, on social media, he has alluded to punching me "in the fucking throat" in addition to calling me some choice names. Why is he so upset? Because for the same seven years Far West has been late I've been publicly throwing his own words back at him. Guess that makes me a c-word ;P   https://www.mutedhorn.net/far-west-delivery-estimates

item.title: E238 - Where I See the Anchor Podcast Community Now and in the Future
item.description: Yesterday's interview with Vince Florio has certainly been a discussion generator when it comes to the Anchor Podcast Community. Obviously, I use Anchor and I'm in its debt, as it lowered the entry bar to podcasting, much like Blogger lowered the entry bar to blogging. I suspect the influx of Anchor podcasts will level out once the new shiny has worn off. In this episode, I talk about where I think the Anchor community is right now and where I suspect it will eventually be.

Come for the Traveller talk, stay for the AD&D 2e observations ;) . Above includes an affiliate link. Affiliate links keep the beer cold at all things Tavern.

item.title: E231 - Defeat Doesn't Need to Equal Death for Your PCs
item.description: As was discussed earlier in the Tavern Chat weekly hangout on our Discord server, too often we see character defeat equal death. Retreat and capture rarely if ever seem like options and perhaps they should be.

item.title: E221 - It is Time for the Majority of Gamers to be Heard. Support That Which You Love
item.description: Sadly, it doesn't stop. Since yesterday's episode, Stacy has now gone so far as to insinuate that violence maybe be used to achieve her goals (what those goals are exactly, aside from attacking Gary Con, Bill Webb and the OSR are ill defined. We've allowed her to be the only voice for too long. Its time to defend our hobby, our creators, our publishers, our conventions and our communities. Speak up!
item.dc:creator: erik tenkar

We've allowed her to be the only voice for too long. Its time to defend our hobby, our creators, our publishers, our conventions and our communities. Speak up!

item.title: E220 - The OSR is Under Attack - Roll for Initiative!
item.description: The attempted boycott of Gary Con continues. The target is no longer one guest, or one convention - the whole of the OSR is under attack by Stacy Dellorfano. You can stand by and do nothing, or you can support the creators, conventions and communities that are part of the larger OSR.

item.title: E211 - Hawk the Slayer - I Finally Watched from Beginning to End
item.description: Yep, apparently I never actually watch Hawk the Slayer in its entirety until this morning. You can find it to stream on Amazon (3 bucks to rent / 10 to buy) Its a fun movie so long as you go into it accepting its limitations - low budget, poor acting, lame special effects, and a horrid script. Pass me the beer and popcorn please!

item.title: E210 - Designers & Makers #1 - Interview with Michael "BadMike" Badolato (NTRPG Con/Frog God Games)

Michael "BadMike" Badolato has the notoriety of being our first guest in the series. BadMike is one of the main guys behind the NTRPG Con, works for Frog God Games and does his own business selling old school games on eBay. Join us as BadMike answers "Ths Five Questions" after which we free range a bit ;)

item.title: E203 - Languages in AD&D 1e - Even the Dumbest Thief Starts Out with Three. Why?
item.description: Ever since last night, some of the language rules in AD&D 1e have been irking me. Alignment tongues, Druid and Thief languages, nine starting languages for elves (ten if they are a thief) - this and more make me question how language was used in 1e.
item.dc:creator: erik tenkar

item.title: E195 - Save or Die? Maybe, but what else can we do?

item.title: E186 - TARGA - Its History, Its Death and an Inside View - Are We Doomed to Repeat?
item.description: I apologize in advance for the extra-long episode. As I was putting the pieces of the episode together, I discovered a post on our very own TenkarsTavern.com from 2014 that shed further light on the battle for the soul of TARGA, from the one that fought said battle. Additional material is at the end of the episode. It was too relevant to not include. I touch upon the current OSR logo drama too.

item.title: E185 - Does the Graphic Define the OSR or Does the OSR Define the Graphic? Does the Graphic Matter?

item.title: E184 - Mundane Magic - Spells and Items - Why is This Overlooked in Most Fantasy RPGs?
item.description: I got it into my head today to think about mundane magic. I understand why RPG rulebooks focus on the magic aimed for adventuring, but in societies where magic replaces technologoy, wouldnt there be more mundane uses?
item.dc:creator: erik tenkar

item.title: E183 - I Tell a Story of Mid 80s Convention Play, Rules Lawyering and the Mantra "Don't be a Dick"
item.description: I'm not sure if I actually made my save vs Con Crud. It may be a delayed reaction. Back in 86 or 87, I went to my first gaming convention at Columbia University in Manhattan. It was one of the few times I've up and up "rules lawyered" and I probably use my druid's Rock to Mud spell in a way the rules as written did not expect.

item.title: E161 - Finding Hidden Treasures in Second Hand RPG Acquisitions
item.description: Glen Halstrom left a voicemail with an interesting note - he picked up an RPG book second hand and it included the prior owner's unique map for their fantasy world. I find that the little extras - notes, remarks, names and even underlining, imparts a sense of history with some second-hand RPG purchases. What are your thoughts? You can leave a voicemail at (347) 509-5168

item.title: E157 - The Complete, Untold Story Behind the Origins of Swords & Wizardry Light
item.description: Man, the amount of tinfoil hats in our corner of the hobby is simply amazing at times. No, Swords & Wizardry Light was not written to usurp legitimacy and authority from Swords & Wizardry Complete. How could it? They are both published by the same company. No, Swords & Wizardry Light was not written to "dumb down" the OSR and lead to its destruction from within. It was written to lower the barriers of entry to the OSR. Gather around children and your bartender will tell you the true story of the Origins of Swords & Wizardry Light...

How do you cope with such if you do?

item.title: E152 - The Times, They are a Changin' - but I still have a cold ;)
item.description:
Yep, I'm still a miserable fuck, having woken up 1130 in the morning - damn cold. The Tavern has been around for nearly 10 years. I expect it will be around for many more 10s of years. If you look at the history of the Tenkar's Tavern blog, you'll see it has always been in a process of change.
Pexx over on the Discord side of all things Tavern is indexing those nearly 10 years of blog posts, and just a few months in he's already seeing changes. Growths. Missteps. All part of the process. All that which will bring us where we are, not just yesterday, but today and tomorrow too.
Yes, change sucks. Yes, change is great.

item.title: E146 - Google to Shut Down G+ After Exposing User Info - OSR Migration has Started to MeWe
item.description: What do you do if you expose the user info of half a million of your users? Shut down the service, that's what. Google has given G+ users a 10-month warning that its social media platform is going the way of the dodo. Most migration in the OSR Community appears to be heading towards MeWe. https://www.tenkarstavern.com/2018/10/google-plus-to-come-to-end-august-2019.html https://www.tenkarstavern.com/2018/10/the-mass-migration-of-osr-from-google.html

item.title: Episode 109 - Using Skills Learned from RPGs in Real Life
item.description: Whether in retail or law enforcement, I used skills learned in my formative roleplaying game years to help me in my chosen careers. I'd love to hear from others how RPGs have impacted their lives, in employment and beyond. tenkars-tavern.games/patreon

item.title: Episode 108 - Making Morale Checks - Real Life & In Game
item.description: Its the first day of September, which means its the anniversary of the Invasion of Poland. Pete Spahn has put WWII: Operation White Box at PWYW pricing to commemorate. It also means the anniversary of 9-11 is sneaking up, and I use it as an example of a real-life moral check as well as how to use it as an example of how to adjust morale checks in game. https://www.rpgnow.com/product/251318/OWB001-WWII-Operation-WhiteBox-FREE?affiliate_id=1446 (affiliate link)

item.title: Episode 91 - Ennies, They are a Changing (no more stuffing?)
item.description: The ENnies Awards blog has posted that there will be upcoming changes in how the winners get picked (few details if any) in response to the "gaming" of the vote by Zak S and James Raggi. The same "gaming" of the vote they tell you not to do while telling you exactly how to do it. The same "gaming" of the vote that has been done for years by others, including major publishers, I am sure. The ENnies are not an industry Award, they are a rigged popularity contest. It just that the wrong folks rigged the contest this year. http://www.ennie-awards.com/blog/ennie-awards-time-for-change/
item.dc:creator: erik tenkar

item.title: Episode 71 - Reminiscing about the AD&D 1e Fiend Folio
item.description:
The AD&D 1e Fiend Folio holds a special place in my personal gaming history - it was the first time I ever saw HD defined for monsters. My players never had it so good as when I thought 4+1 HD was 5 HP. Doh!
The quality of the creatures included ranges from awesome to WTF!?!, but you knew that, right? :)

item.title: Episode #18 - AD&D 1e Player's Handbook - The Thief is not Meant to be a Stand Alone Class
item.description: In today's episode, I take a look at the AD&D 1e Thief class and why I think it was meant to keep players of demihuman races involved until "the end game" and has less value as a "solo class". Danke makes an appearance and Glen is nowhere to be found ;)
item.dc:creator: erik tenkar
item.itunes:summary: In today's episode, I take a look at the AD&D 1e Thief class and why I think it was meant to keep players of demihuman races involved until "the end game" and has less value as a "solo class". Danke makes an appearance and Glen is nowhere to be found ;)

item.title: Episode #17 - The 1e DMG as a Solo Gaming Resource
item.description: Note, I didn't say the 1e DMG was a Solo RPG Resource, but there were "sub-games" of sorts within the DMG. The Deck of Many Things and the Random Dungeon Generation Tables are two such resources.
item.dc:creator: erik tenkar
item.itunes:summary: Note, I didn't say the 1e DMG was a Solo RPG Resource, but there were "sub-games" of sorts within the DMG. The Deck of Many Things and the Random Dungeon Generation Tables are two such resources.
